page.title: 14ARTS AND CRAFTS
page.content:
CORN DOLLIES
This ancient Egyptian craft was to keep the Goddess of the Harvest safe during the winter. Special wheat is grown in Oxfordshire for this craft. This area used to make straw bonnets but cheaper imports have killed this industry. Although plaiting schools have died out the displays we saw showed it is becoming increasingly popular as a hobby. The examples we saw included: A Glory Braid with one staw for each Apostle;Harvest Crosses;Love Favours to be given to a sweetheart;hedgehogs; cages;mice and a baby's rattle. Our school has a chair with a backing weaved from Black Oats from Orkney.
